aim.aim_description: To make clear that auto-play cannot be offered for online gaming

requirements.title: Individual Game Cycle Commitment Required
requirements.full_text: The gambling system must require a customer to commit to each game cycle individually.

implementation_guidance.full_text: This requirement does not prohibit offering functionality to automatically post blinds in peer-to-peer poker.
key_points: Customer must commit to each game cycle individually
Auto-play NOT permitted for online gaming
Exception: Automatically posting blinds in peer-to-peer poker IS permitted

exception.reasoning: Blinds are structural requirement of poker, not a gamble commitment

requirements.citation: UK Gambling Commission - Remote Technical Standards, RTS Requirement 8A

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Prevent automated continuous gambling that removes customer control and decision-making
key_principles: Each game cycle requires individual customer commitment
Customer must actively choose each gamble
Poker blinds exception recognizes structural game requirement
compliance_notes.rationale: Auto-play removes customer control and can facilitate rapid, uncontrolled losses

related_requirements: RTS 13 - Time Requirements and Reality Checks

permitted: Customer clicks 'spin' for each slot game
Customer places each individual bet on table game
Automatic posting of blinds in poker (structural requirement)

document_metadata.source: UK Gambling Commission - Remote Technical Standards
